channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Will Smith issues apology to Chris Rock over slapping incident at Oscars. https://t.co/HWw5otHn34
The drone operators who halted Russian convoy headed for Kyiv. https://t.co/pix6O2uNgf
Trump likely committed felony obstruction, federal judge rules. https://t.co/3ZOf2Im1Jw
This is one of the most powerful scenes in Mystic River. https://t.co/8bxzgxzqQw
Paolo has been blogging for 20 years. https://t.co/Z7DS0ANg4v

We're still under Putin's thumb. That's the uneasy feeling that somehow the discussion is missing the big picture. Putin's PR in the US is Fox News. The only mystery is what the deal is, who's paying whom. Murdoch and Putin, they're in charge. Until we fight back.
Do people who write the news understand this? â¬†ï¸Ž

1/7 I watched King Richard over the weekend, so it's fresh in my mind.
2/7 There's a scene where Smith and his daughters are on a tennis court in Compton, all of his daughters, not just Venus and Serena. There are a bunch of asshole teenage boys nearby who are hassling one of his daughters who's trying to study.
3/7 After they're done practicing, Smith confronts the boys. They beat him up. He does nothing to respond, he just takes it (like Chris Rock last night).
4/7 Later in the movie he's bullied by an agent and his response is to fart out loud at him (which I like, it's aggressive but nonviolent). The agent definitely had it coming.
5/7 Later, the character tells Venus a story about him getting beat up as a kid, and his father was nearby and did nothing to help him.
6/7 The speech Smith gave in accepting his award could have been the speech the character in the movie would have made. About protecting people.
7/7 No conclusions, it's just odd how closely the events last night track the ones in the movie, but opposite. What the character did is hard. The character did it right. The actor was confused, life is not a movie, and he got it wrong.
@nakedjen good point!
Heh. Maybe we don't need to raise interest rates so much. ;-) https://t.co/C7JREAA5zB
It's okay to be angry, it's definitely not okay to act out that anger on other people's bodies.
Chris Rock Won't File Police Report After Will Smith Slap at Oscars. https://t.co/76EA0trOAn
Will Smith thought about killing father to 'avenge' his mother. https://t.co/yWTufUOvvx

@AmberMay2021 @JujuliaGrace Maybe he already has been. His behavior was unhinged.

@JujuliaGrace Also there was no physical threat to anyone there, so responding that way is medieval, also incredibly illegal, for all kinds of good reasons. Also really impressed by Chris Rockâ€™s reaction.
@BeaReno did he. i couldn't watch it, was too disgusted. he should have just apologized and sat down.

We just saw Will Smith hit Chris Rock, and this is the speech Smith gives? This is such bullshit.
He should have been thrown out of the venue.

@FeroshUX @elonmusk it's not a dig at twitter. i'm a professional and i do a lot of development work assuming twitter's existence. i'm also a twtr shareholder, btw. any network that doesn't allow peering is going to be under the same kind of political pressure twitter is to ban unpopular people.
Putin launched a regime change war, and some think heâ€™s a victim. https://t.co/iA64jyGdpB
@jeffjarvis @KBAndersen @CNN @MSNBC @NewsHour CNN and MSNBC should teach us about the political system in Russia, a preview of our own system if we don't start fighting our homegrown fascists.

This fascist was president of the United States. https://t.co/StX5WDRsNj
I had a mentor back when I was a software entrepreneur. He told a metaphoric story how in the army they teach soldiers if they see a dead enemy on the side of the road, you should put a bullet in his head, just to be sure.
@jeffjarvis @mkarolian I hope he does follow through. We need another entry in this space. I posted a tweet for him with a plan. https://t.co/hcpdUTLlxO
Assistant Coach Immanuel Quickley. ;-) https://t.co/H50AoenpMp
